alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 05 at 12:05PM AKST until February 06 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and wind chills to 65 below zero. East winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills to 65 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions will continue at Point Lay through Monday morning. Very cold wind chills will continue in all areas through Monday morning, and then remain at Point Lay through Monday afternoon. The strongest winds and worst conditions are from Point Lay south.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
